title: How to overcome impostor syndrome while changing a career - Quora

response.answer_text: Simply know your accomplishments and be proud of what you could offer (in other words always know what you have to offer is one of a kind though it sometimes might not feel like it, know your value) and be open to learning constantly because let’s face it we can’t ever know everything. This actually makes us be excited and curious about anything we embrace in life. Good luck and stay blessed!

With questions and admitting what you don't know. Never be afraid to say “I'm new and I don' get what you're saying”. Since you work on a team there is a goal. Frame your questions with a full understanding of the goal, not the implementation of the solution. As a newbie you often can offer divergent paths from the accepted practice that reveal efficiencies
